node.title: Tairāwhiti state of emergency lifted after flooding
node.description: The state of emergency in Tairāwhiti has this afternoon been lifted after three days of torrential rain.
node.content:
["The state of emergency in Tair\u0101whiti has this afternoon been lifted after three days of torrential rain.", "", "
\nPhoto: Supplied / Cook Island News / Gary Clapham\n
", "The state of emergency was declared in the area yesterday as heavy rain pounded the region", "Tair\u0101whiti Civil Defence group controller Dave Wilson said landslides remained an ongoing risk due to saturated ground.", "Homes in Hill Road have been evacuated, and engineers continue to monitor the situation.", "Contractors in Gisborne have started cleaning properties affected by tainted flood water.", "Wilson said Civil Defence crews would continue to monitor the region over the weekend.", "He warned people who lived on hillsides and river banks to check for signs of subsidence, such as cracks or water coming out of unusual places, lawns sagging, retaining walls or trees on strange angles, creaking noises or doors sticking.", "He said people should contact the council if they had any concerns."]
